communities.name: Bitcoin Indonesia #1
communities.description: Bitcoin Indonesia is a non-profit organization dedicated to promoting Bitcoin adoption through education and community building across Indonesia.

weeklyData.description: Explore the fascinating history of Bitcoin, from its mysterious origins with Satoshi Nakamoto to its evolution into a global phenomenon. Learn about key historical events, early development, and the fundamental principles that make Bitcoin revolutionary.

weeklyCall.description:
Dear Bitcoiners!

Welcome to Decoding Bitcoin study cohort launch session where we will have a quick presentation from Jamal, creator of Decoding Bitcoin platform. We will set a few expectations, answer any questions, and get to know each other. No preparation needed ðŸ˜‡

Location - Lounge channel on Discord:
https://discord.gg/6XPJ96sCY4

weeklyData.description: Dive into Bitcoin's scripting language, understanding how the stack-based execution model works, different types of opcodes, and the relationship between locking and unlocking scripts. Learn about script validation rules and standardness policies.

baseQuestions.text: How does the Turing incompleteness of Bitcoin Script contribute to the security and efficiency of the Bitcoin network?
Compare standard and non-standard scripts in Bitcoin. How are they handled by the network?
What are the potential consequences of a script leaving multiple items on the stack after execution? How does this affect the validity of a transaction?
What is the IsStandard() function and how does it affect transaction relay policies?
What' s the difference between OP_CHECKSIG and OP_CHECKMULTISIG?
Explain the difference between OP_PUSHDATA1, OP_PUSHDATA2, and OP_PUSHDATA4
Explain how stack operations work in Bitcoin Script and provide an example of OP _ ADD execution
What are the main categories of Bitcoin opcodes and their purposes?
Describe the relationship between locking and unlocking scripts in Bitcoin transactions
What determines script success or failure in Bitcoin? Explain the validation rules

Dear Bitcoiners!

Welcome to Decoding Bitcoin study cohort launch session where we will have a quick presentation from Jamal, creator of Decoding Bitcoin platform. We will set a few expectations, answer any questions, and get to know each other. No preparation needed ðŸ˜‡

Location - Lounge channel on Discord:
https://discord.gg/6XPJ96sCY4

additionalResources.title: Bitcoin Script Reference Guide
additionalResources.description: Complete documentation of Bitcoin Script operations and examples
additionalResources.author: Bitcoin Core

weeklyData.description: Study the earliest and simplest form of Bitcoin transactions - Pay to Public Key (P2PK). Analyze historical transactions, understand the role of public key cryptography, and learn why this script type was eventually superseded.

baseQuestions.text: What are the three main challenges associated with P2PK transactions? Explain each challenge.

In the first Bitcoin transaction (block 170), Satoshi sent 10 BTC to Hal Finney using a P2PK script. Analyze the provided hex code for the transaction, breaking down the input, output, and script components.
Why did Satoshi Nakamoto use uncompressed public keys in early Bitcoin transactions, and what are the benefits of compressed keys?
During transaction validation, explain how are ScriptPubKey and ScriptSig combined, and why?
In the examples provided, what are the hex representations of OP_PUSHBYTES_65 and OP_CHECKSIG in the ScriptPubKey?

Describe in detail how OP_CHECKSIG operates on the stack in a P2PK transaction. What inputs does it consume, and what outputs does it produce? (You can also refer to the OpCode animations we have seen in previous week lesson)
For a concatenated script <Signature Finney> <Public Key Finney> OP_CHECKSIG, describe each step of its evaluation during the unlocking process. How does the stack state evolve?
The ScriptPubKey in a P2PK transaction includes the public key directly. If a compression method were used, how would the hex representation of the script change?
What are the specific conditions under which OP_CHECKSIG would return FALSE during script execution in a P2PK transaction?

weeklyCall.description:
Dear Bitcoiners!

Welcome to Decoding Bitcoin study cohort launch session where we will have a quick presentation from Jamal, creator of Decoding Bitcoin platform. We will set a few expectations, answer any questions, and get to know each other. No preparation needed ðŸ˜‡

Location - Lounge channel on Discord:
https://discord.gg/6XPJ96sCY4

weeklyData.description: Examine the most common historical Bitcoin script type - P2PKH. Learn about the benefits of hashing public keys, improved privacy features, and analyze real-world transactions including the famous Bitcoin pizza transaction.

baseQuestions.text: What is the difference between P2PKH and P2PK transactions?
What is the purpose of the OP_DUP and OP_HASH160 opcodes in a P2PKH locking script?
Describe the process of constructing a P2PKH scriptPubKey from a given public key. What are the exact steps and opcodes used?
Why does P2PKH lock bitcoins to the hash of a public key instead of the public key itself?
What opcodes are used in a P2PKH scriptPubKey, and what are their functions?
At what point is the public key revealed in a P2PKH transaction?
Why is P2PKH considered more private and secure compared to revealing the full public key in the transaction output?
What steps must Bob take to spend the bitcoins sent to his P2PKH address?
Given the hexadecimal representation of a scriptPubKey, describe the process to decode it into its ASM (Assembly) equivalent.
If you were provided with the following P2PKH scriptPubKey: `76a9147d1980cd67f0ed29a94793823b866bf47eab965e88ac`, decode it to identify the public key hash and explain the purpose of each component.

weeklyCall.description:
Dear Bitcoiners!

Welcome to Decoding Bitcoin study cohort launch session where we will have a quick presentation from Jamal, creator of Decoding Bitcoin platform. We will set a few expectations, answer any questions, and get to know each other. No preparation needed ðŸ˜‡

Location - Lounge channel on Discord:
https://discord.gg/6XPJ96sCY4

weeklyData.description: Understand how P2SH revolutionized Bitcoin's scripting capabilities by allowing complex redemption conditions to be hidden in a hash. Learn about script composition, validation rules, and the flexibility P2SH brought to Bitcoin.

baseQuestions.text: What is the main purpose of P2SH, and how does it differ from P2PKH?
How can you identify a P2SH address by looking at it? What distinguishes it from other Bitcoin address types?
What is the correct sequence of hashing operations needed to create a P2SH address from a redeem script?
When spending from a P2SH address, what two conditions must be met for the transaction to be valid?
What is a common use case for P2SH, and why is it beneficial in this scenario?
What is the role of the IsStandard() function in the context of P2SH, and how has it changed since Bitcoin Core release 0.10.0?
Explain the difference between a redeem script and a locking script in the context of P2SH
What are the steps involved in creating a P2SH address from a redeem script?

weeklyCall.description:
Dear Bitcoiners!

Welcome to Decoding Bitcoin study cohort launch session where we will have a quick presentation from Jamal, creator of Decoding Bitcoin platform. We will set a few expectations, answer any questions, and get to know each other. No preparation needed ðŸ˜‡

Location - Lounge channel on Discord:
https://discord.gg/6XPJ96sCY4

weeklyData.description: Explore multi-signature scripts in Bitcoin, both in their bare form and wrapped in P2SH. Learn about threshold signatures, key management considerations, and how multisig enhances Bitcoin's security model.

baseQuestions.text: Explain the difference between 'standardness' and 'validity' in the context of P2MS transactions. What are the limits for each?
In a P2MS ScriptPubKey, what are the essential components that must be included in the correct order?
Why is OP_0 included at the beginning of the ScriptSig in P2MS transactions? What bug does this address?
What is the maximum number of public keys allowed in a standard (non-P2SH) P2MS script, and why is this limit in place?
In a 1-of-3 multisig setup, explain why matching signatures with the first public key is more efficient than matching with the last one.
For a 2-of-3 multisig transaction, what would the unlocking script (ScriptSig) contain?
How can you overcome the 3-public-key limitation of standard P2MS, and what is the new limit when using this method?
What is the primary purpose of a P2MS (Pay-to-Multisig) transaction in Bitcoin?

weeklyCall.description:
Dear Bitcoiners!

Welcome to Decoding Bitcoin study cohort launch session where we will have a quick presentation from Jamal, creator of Decoding Bitcoin platform. We will set a few expectations, answer any questions, and get to know each other. No preparation needed ðŸ˜‡

weeklyData.description: Begin your journey into Bitcoin's latest script upgrade - Taproot. Learn about Schnorr signatures, tagged hashes, and the fundamental building blocks that enable improved privacy and scalability in Bitcoin.

baseQuestions.text: What is the purpose of a nonce in Schnorr signatures, and why is it crucial not to reuse it?
What security vulnerability could occur if you implement MuSig public key aggregation by simply adding the public keys together (P_agg = P_a + P_b + P_c)?
What are the three rounds of communication required in MuSig signature generation, and why are they necessary?
If an attacker observes two different Schnorr signatures that used the same nonce k, explain step by step how they can derive the private key d.
Explain how MuSig improves privacy and transaction efficiency in Bitcoin.
Describe the key cancellation attack in the context of MuSig

weeklyCall.description:
Dear Bitcoiners!

Welcome to Decoding Bitcoin study cohort launch session where we will have a quick presentation from Jamal, creator of Decoding Bitcoin platform. We will set a few expectations, answer any questions, and get to know each other. No preparation needed ðŸ˜‡

Location - Lounge channel on Discord:
https://discord.gg/6XPJ96sCY4

weeklyData.description: Deep dive into advanced Taproot concepts including MuSig, key aggregation, and taptweak operations. Understand how these components work together to create more efficient and private Bitcoin transactions.

communities.name: Bitcoin Indonesia #2
communities.description: Bitcoin Indonesia is a non-profit organization dedicated to promoting Bitcoin adoption through education and community building across Indonesia.

weeklyData.description: Explore the fascinating history of Bitcoin, from its mysterious origins with Satoshi Nakamoto to its evolution into a global phenomenon. Learn about key historical events, early development, and the fundamental principles that make Bitcoin revolutionary.

baseQuestions.text: What is the purpose of the version number in a Bitcoin transaction, and how do different versions affect transaction rules?
How do the marker and flag indicate a SegWit transaction, and how do old nodes handle these fields?
How does Bitcoin determine which previous transaction outputs can be used as inputs in a new transaction?
What is the purpose of the locktime field, and how does it affect when a transaction becomes valid?
How do ScriptSig and ScriptPubKey work together to validate Bitcoin transactions? Explain with an example.
Why is the output index (vout) necessary in a transaction input, and what happens if an incorrect vout is referenced?
How are transaction fees determined based on inputs and outputs, and why are they necessary for miners?
What is the role of the witness field in SegWit transactions, and how does it help reduce transaction malleability?
How do sequence numbers enable Replace-By-Fee (RBF), and why would a user want to use RBF?
Why is Bitcoin transaction data serialized in little-endian format, and how does this affect how transactions are displayed on explorers?
Why does Bitcoin use the UTXO model instead of the account model, and what are the trade-offs?
How does transaction creation differ in the UTXO model compared to the account model?
What is the difference between big-endian and little-endian, and how does Bitcoin use them?
What is transaction weight, and why was it introduced in Bitcoin?
What factors determine the transaction fee in Bitcoin, and how is the fee rate calculated?
What is Compact Size (var_int) encoding, and where is it used in Bitcoin transactions?
What is Replace-By-Fee (RBF), and how does it help users get their transactions confirmed faster?
What is the main difference between Opt-in RBF and Full RBF?
How does the Child Pays for Parent (CPFP) mechanism work, and when should it be used?
Why would a user choose CPFP instead of RBF when dealing with a stuck transaction?
What is the purpose of signing a Bitcoin transaction, and how does it ensure security?
What is the difference between signing a legacy transaction (P2PKH) and a SegWit transaction (P2WPKH)?
Why do SegWit transactions require a special field called 'witness,' and how does it change the transaction format?
What are the key components of the signing process in a Bitcoin transaction?
What is a sighash, and how does it determine which parts of a transaction are signed?
Why does Bitcoin use double SHA-256 hashing before signing a transaction?
What are some common errors that can cause a Bitcoin transaction signature to fail?
Why does Bitcoin require a 'low S value' in signatures, and how does it prevent malleability?
Why do SegWit transactions still require a scriptCode when signing a P2WPKH input?
How does Bitcoin ensure that a signed transaction cannot be modified after broadcasting?

weeklyData.description: Dive into Bitcoin's scripting language, understanding how the stack-based execution model works, different types of opcodes, and the relationship between locking and unlocking scripts. Learn about script validation rules and standardness policies.

baseQuestions.text: How does the Turing incompleteness of Bitcoin Script contribute to the security and efficiency of the Bitcoin network?
Compare standard and non-standard scripts in Bitcoin. How are they handled by the network?
What are the potential consequences of a script leaving multiple items on the stack after execution? How does this affect the validity of a transaction?
What is the IsStandard() function and how does it affect transaction relay policies?
What' s the difference between OP_CHECKSIG and OP_CHECKMULTISIG?
Explain the difference between OP_PUSHDATA1, OP_PUSHDATA2, and OP_PUSHDATA4
Explain how stack operations work in Bitcoin Script and provide an example of OP _ ADD execution
What are the main categories of Bitcoin opcodes and their purposes?
Describe the relationship between locking and unlocking scripts in Bitcoin transactions
What determines script success or failure in Bitcoin? Explain the validation rules

additionalResources.title: Bitcoin Script Reference Guide
additionalResources.description: Complete documentation of Bitcoin Script operations and examples
additionalResources.author: Bitcoin Core

weeklyData.description: Explore the evolution of Bitcoin's transaction scripts, from the earliest Pay-to-Public-Key (P2PK) to the more advanced Pay-to-Public-Key-Hash (P2PKH). Study historical transactions, understand public key cryptography, and learn how P2PKH improved upon P2PK by introducing better privacy and security features through public key hashing.

baseQuestions.text: Compare and contrast P2PK and P2PKH transactions in terms of script structure, security, and privacy. What specific improvements does P2PKH offer over P2PK?

In the first Bitcoin transaction (block 170), Satoshi sent 10 BTC to Hal Finney using a P2PK script. Analyze the provided hex code for the transaction, breaking down the input, output, and script components.
Describe in detail how OP_CHECKSIG operates on the stack in both P2PK and P2PKH transactions. What inputs does it consume, and what outputs does it produce in each case?
For a P2PKH transaction, explain the complete validation process from scriptSig to scriptPubKey execution, including the role of OP_DUP and OP_HASH160. How does this differ from P2PK validation?
Given a P2PKH scriptPubKey '76a9147d1980cd67f0ed29a94793823b866bf47eab965e88ac', decode each component and explain its purpose. How would this differ in a P2PK script?
Why did Satoshi Nakamoto use uncompressed public keys in early P2PK transactions, and how has key compression evolved in P2PKH? What are the technical benefits and tradeoffs?
Analyze the security implications of revealing public keys in P2PK vs P2PKH transactions. How does this affect quantum resistance and address reuse?
For a concatenated P2PK script '<Signature> <Public Key> OP_CHECKSIG', describe each step of stack evaluation. Then compare this with the more complex P2PKH stack operations.

Given a transaction with both P2PK and P2PKH inputs, calculate the total size in bytes for both scriptSigs and scriptPubKeys. Explain why P2PKH transactions are generally larger, and discuss the implications for transaction fees.

Design a script that combines both P2PK and P2PKH elements in a single output (theoretical exercise). Explain why this would or wouldn't be practical, considering script evaluation rules, standardness policies, and potential security implications.

weeklyData.description: Understand how P2SH revolutionized Bitcoin's scripting capabilities by allowing complex redemption conditions to be hidden in a hash. Learn about script composition, validation rules, and the flexibility P2SH brought to Bitcoin.

baseQuestions.text: What is the main purpose of P2SH, and how does it differ from P2PKH?
How can you identify a P2SH address by looking at it? What distinguishes it from other Bitcoin address types?
What is the correct sequence of hashing operations needed to create a P2SH address from a redeem script?
When spending from a P2SH address, what two conditions must be met for the transaction to be valid?
What is a common use case for P2SH, and why is it beneficial in this scenario?
What is the role of the IsStandard() function in the context of P2SH, and how has it changed since Bitcoin Core release 0.10.0?
Explain the difference between a redeem script and a locking script in the context of P2SH
What are the steps involved in creating a P2SH address from a redeem script?

weeklyData.description: Explore multi-signature scripts in Bitcoin, both in their bare form and wrapped in P2SH. Learn about threshold signatures, key management considerations, and how multisig enhances Bitcoin's security model.

baseQuestions.text: Explain the difference between 'standardness' and 'validity' in the context of P2MS transactions. What are the limits for each?
In a P2MS ScriptPubKey, what are the essential components that must be included in the correct order?
Why is OP_0 included at the beginning of the ScriptSig in P2MS transactions? What bug does this address?
What is the maximum number of public keys allowed in a standard (non-P2SH) P2MS script, and why is this limit in place?
In a 1-of-3 multisig setup, explain why matching signatures with the first public key is more efficient than matching with the last one.
For a 2-of-3 multisig transaction, what would the unlocking script (ScriptSig) contain?
How can you overcome the 3-public-key limitation of standard P2MS, and what is the new limit when using this method?
What is the primary purpose of a P2MS (Pay-to-Multisig) transaction in Bitcoin?
